firstLaunch.name: firstLaunch
firstLaunch.help: This was the first time Ragdoll was installed

firstLaunch2.name: firstLaunch2
firstLaunch2.help: This was the first time Ragdoll was launched, since licencing was implemented.

firstLaunch3.name: firstLaunch3
firstLaunch3.help: This was the first time Ragdoll was launched since 2021.04.23.

upgradeOnSceneOpen.name: upgradeOnSceneOpen
upgradeOnSceneOpen.help: Whether or not to check for upgradable nodes on scene-open.

scale.name: scale
scale.label: Draw Scale
scale.help: Scale at which to draw viewport widgets, like constraints.

cacheMedia.name: cacheMedia
cacheMedia.help:
Cache clips in the timeline, for immediate feedback when scroll.
- Off Fast, interactive but no scrubbing.
- On Slow scrubbing support.
- All Interactive scrubbing at the expense of RAM.

initialShape.name: initialShape
initialShape.help: Which shape to start out with, 'Auto' means it will determine the shape based on the Maya geometry type. Mesh translates Maya geometry into an optimised collision shape (a.k.a. 'Convex Hull')

color.name: color
color.help: Initial color used, can be changed later.

computeMass2.name: computeMass2
computeMass2.label: Compute Mass
computeMass2.help: Use the volume and density of the shape to determine its mass. Use with caution, as large differences (10x or more) in mass amongst rigids that interact can cause instability.

createRigidType.name: createRigidType
createRigidType.label: Rigid Type
createRigidType.help:
How to solve this rigid.
- Active : Simulate this node
- Passive : Animate this node

rigidDefaults.name: rigidDefaults
rigidDefaults.label: Rigid Type
rigidDefaults.help:
How to solve this rigid.
- Active : Simulate this node
- Passive : Animate this node

shapeExtents.name: shapeExtents
shapeExtents.help: The XYZ scale of the Box shape type

shapeLength.name: shapeLength
shapeLength.help: The length of the capsule and cylinder shape types

shapeRadius.name: shapeRadius
shapeRadius.help: The length of the capsule and cylinder shape types

convertRigidType.name: convertRigidType
convertRigidType.label: Rigid Type
convertRigidType.help: Convert a rigid from active to kinematic or vice versa. 'Opposite' turns passive into active and vice versa automatically.

rigidSelect.name: rigidSelect
rigidSelect.label: Select
rigidSelect.help: Automatically select newly created rigid body.

autoOrient.name: autoOrient
autoOrient.help: Orient constraint automatically by aiming towards the immediate child. Otherwise use the local orientation of the node.

autoReturnToStart.name: autoReturnToStart
autoReturnToStart.help: Automatically return to the start frame whenever creating new rigid bodies.

existingAnimation.name: existingAnimation
existingAnimation.help: Should a constraint be made to try and follow the original animation?

constraintGuideStrength.name: constraintGuideStrength
constraintGuideStrength.label: Guide Strength
constraintGuideStrength.help: Include some guide strength with this constraint.

convertConstraintType.name: convertConstraintType
convertConstraintType.help: The type of constraint to convert to.

constraintUseRotatePivot.name: constraintUseRotatePivot
constraintUseRotatePivot.label: Use Rotate Pivot
constraintUseRotatePivot.help: Use rotate pivot of child as offset for the constraint frames.

maintainOffset.name: maintainOffset
maintainOffset.help: Keep rigids where they are, or snap them together. Offsets can be manipulated with the Edit Constraint Frames menu item.

addUserAttributes.name: addUserAttributes
addUserAttributes.help: Expose common physics attributes on the original animation controls, like Mass of rigids and Guide Strength of constraints.

characterCopy.name: characterCopy
characterCopy.label: Copy
characterCopy.help: Turn a copy of the selected hierarchy into a character, rather than the hierarchy itself.

characterControl.name: characterControl
characterControl.label: Control
characterControl.help: Create an additional control hierarchy from generated character.

characterStopBehaviour.name: characterStopBehaviour
characterStopBehaviour.label: Stop Behaviour
characterStopBehaviour.help: Whether to include the joint with a 'Stop' label in the generated character or not.

characterSkipBehaviour.name: characterSkipBehaviour
characterSkipBehaviour.label: Skip Behaviour
characterSkipBehaviour.help: Whether to include the joint with a 'Skip' label in the generated character or not.

characterNormalise.name: characterNormalise
characterNormalise.label: Normalise Shapes
characterNormalise.help: Make sure shapes are relatively evenly sized. This can help prevent 'stick-figures' which are tougher to control.

muscleAimAxis.name: muscleAimAxis
muscleAimAxis.label: Aim Axis
muscleAimAxis.help: Which axis to treat as aim for the resulting muscle.

muscleUpAxis.name: muscleUpAxis
muscleUpAxis.label: Up Axis
muscleUpAxis.help: Which axis to treat as the up-axis for the resulting muscle.

muscleFlex.name: muscleFlex
muscleFlex.label: Flex
muscleFlex.help: How much to allow the muscle to contract, from not-at-all to all-the-way.

muscleRadius.name: muscleRadius
muscleRadius.label: Radius
muscleRadius.help: Capsule radius, how thick of a muscle to make.

initialStateUseSelection.name: initialStateUseSelection
initialStateUseSelection.label: Use Selection
initialStateUseSelection.help: Clear initial state on selection only, or everything in the related scene.

selectUseSelection.name: selectUseSelection
selectUseSelection.label: Use Selection
selectUseSelection.help: Filter current selection by type. For example, with an entire hierarchy selected, remove anything that isn't a 'rdRigid' node.

freezeEvaluation.name: freezeEvaluation
freezeEvaluation.label: Freeze
freezeEvaluation.help: Freeze, or unfreeze the selected nodes.

freezeEvaluationHierarchy.name: freezeEvaluationHierarchy
freezeEvaluationHierarchy.label: Include Hierarchy
freezeEvaluationHierarchy.help: Include the selected hierarchy, including shapes.

freezeEvaluationShapesOnly.name: freezeEvaluationShapesOnly
freezeEvaluationShapesOnly.label: Shapes Only
freezeEvaluationShapesOnly.help: Leave transforms alone. This won't bring half as much performance, but can make e.g. joint hierarchies render properly.

tuneMirrored.name: tuneMirrored
tuneMirrored.label: Tune Mirrored
tuneMirrored.help: Dragging left rotates in the positive per default, this toggle flips that around.

tuneMirrored.name: tuneMirrored
tuneMirrored.label: Tune Mirrored
tuneMirrored.help: Dragging left rotates in the positive per default, this toggle flips that around.

mimicExclusive.name: mimicExclusive
mimicExclusive.label: Make Exclusive
mimicExclusive.help: Disable any other constraints influencing this chain, making this the exclusive influence.

mimicAddMultiplier.name: mimicAddMultiplier
mimicAddMultiplier.label: Add Globals
mimicAddMultiplier.help: Add a multiplier to the root of the newly created mimic.

mimicAddUserAttributes.name: mimicAddUserAttributes
mimicAddUserAttributes.label: Add User Attributes
mimicAddUserAttributes.help: Forward attributes from shape nodes to the main transform of the mimic.

rigidAddUserAttributes.name: rigidAddUserAttributes
rigidAddUserAttributes.label: Add User Attributes
rigidAddUserAttributes.help: Forward attributes from rigid to the parent transform.

mimicAddSoftPin.name: mimicAddSoftPin
mimicAddSoftPin.label: Add Soft Pin
mimicAddSoftPin.help: Add soft pin constraints between the mimic and chain.

mimicAddHardPin.name: mimicAddHardPin
mimicAddHardPin.label: Add Hard Pin
mimicAddHardPin.help: Add hard pin influences between the mimic and chain.

mimicFreezeTransform.name: mimicFreezeTransform
mimicFreezeTransform.label: Freeze Transform
mimicFreezeTransform.help: Zero out translate and rotate values on the newly created mimic. (Requires Maya 2020 and above)

mimicCleanChannelBox.name: mimicCleanChannelBox
mimicCleanChannelBox.label: Clean Channel Box
mimicCleanChannelBox.help: Hide shape nodes from the channel box, leaving only the attributes on the transform node present.

mimicNodeType.name: mimicNodeType
mimicNodeType.label: Node Type
mimicNodeType.help: Transform for simplicity, joint for flexibility (such as IK).

chainShapeType.name: chainShapeType
chainShapeType.label: Initial Shape
chainShapeType.help: Which shape to start out with, 'Auto' means it will determine the shape based on the Maya geometry type. Mesh translates Maya geometry into an optimised collision shape (a.k.a. 'Convex Hull')

chainDrawShaded.name: chainDrawShaded
chainDrawShaded.label: Draw Shaded
chainDrawShaded.help: Whether to render the wireframe or shaded surface of rigids.

chainAutoMultiplier.name: chainAutoMultiplier
chainAutoMultiplier.label: Auto Globals
chainAutoMultiplier.help: Automatically add a constraint multiplier to the dynamic control root.

chainAutoLimits.name: chainAutoLimits
chainAutoLimits.label: Auto Limits
chainAutoLimits.help: Generate suitable limits automatically from input.

replaceMeshExclusive.name: replaceMeshExclusive
replaceMeshExclusive.label: Exclusive
replaceMeshExclusive.help: Make this mesh the only input, removing any exising curve or surface that may or may not already be connected.

replaceMeshMaintainOffset.name: replaceMeshMaintainOffset
replaceMeshMaintainOffset.label: Maintain Offset
replaceMeshMaintainOffset.help: Use the worldspace position of the mesh to be replaced.

importPaths.name: importPaths
importPaths.label: Filename
importPaths.help: Other .rag files in the same directory.

importPreserveAttributes.name: importPreserveAttributes
importPreserveAttributes.label: Preserve Attributes
importPreserveAttributes.help: Preserve changes to attributes like 'Shape Extents' and 'Rotate Limit Y' from the exported file.

importAutoNamespace.name: importAutoNamespace
importAutoNamespace.label: Auto Namespace
importAutoNamespace.help: Replace namespace from file with selected namespace.

importAutoScene.name: importAutoScene
importAutoScene.label: Auto Scene
importAutoScene.help: Preserve the original scene from the exported .rag file. If not, create a new scene for every import.

importSearchAndReplace.name: importSearchAndReplace
importSearchAndReplace.label: Search and Replace
importSearchAndReplace.help: Replace part of a full node path, such as a namespace, with another. E.g. replace 'myNamespace:' with 'myOtherNamespace:' to apply contents of one namespace to another.

importMergePhysics.name: importMergePhysics
importMergePhysics.label: Merge
importMergePhysics.help: Apply physics to existing objects in the currently opened Maya scene.

importMethod.name: importMethod
importMethod.help: Load each individual Ragdoll node as they existed at the time of export, or *reinterpret* the exported file to try and figure out what commands were used to create it, and then execute those same commands to the currently opened scene.

importUseSelection.name: importUseSelection
importUseSelection.label: Use Selection
importUseSelection.help: Import onto selection, ignore everything else.

importIncludeControls.name: importIncludeControls
importIncludeControls.label: Include Controls
importIncludeControls.help: Include controls from imported file (if any).

importIncludeAnimation.name: importIncludeAnimation
importIncludeAnimation.label: Include Animation
importIncludeAnimation.help: Include animation from imported file (if any).

importIncludeSimulation.name: importIncludeSimulation
importIncludeSimulation.label: Include Simulation
importIncludeSimulation.help: Include simulation from imported file (if any).

exportIncludeThumbnail.name: exportIncludeThumbnail
exportIncludeThumbnail.label: Include Thumbnail
exportIncludeThumbnail.help: Include a small screenshot of the current scene at the time of export.

bakePerformance.name: bakePerformance
bakePerformance.label: Performance
bakePerformance.help: Improve performance by hiding anything unrelated to the simulation, or disabling the viewport(s) altogether whilst baking.

bakeDeletePhysics.name: bakeDeletePhysics
bakeDeletePhysics.label: Delete Physics
bakeDeletePhysics.help: Delete all on completion, they no longer have any effect.

bakeToLayer.name: bakeToLayer
bakeToLayer.help: Bake to a new animation layer.

bakeIncludeStatic.name: bakeIncludeStatic
bakeIncludeStatic.label: Include Static
bakeIncludeStatic.help: Bake passive rigids too, even though they aren't affected by physics.

bakeUnrollRotation.name: bakeUnrollRotation
bakeUnrollRotation.label: Unroll Rotation
bakeUnrollRotation.help: Let rotations exceed 360 degrees (good for motion blur).

bakeScene.name: bakeScene
bakeScene.label: Scene
bakeScene.help: Limit baking to rigid bodies in this scene.

markersCreateGround.name: markersCreateGround
markersCreateGround.label: Create Ground
markersCreateGround.help: Whether or not to automatically create a ground with a new solver.

markersCreateObjectSet.name: markersCreateObjectSet
markersCreateObjectSet.label: Create Object Set
markersCreateObjectSet.help: Gather all newly created markers into an object set.

markersCreateLollipop.name: markersCreateLollipop
markersCreateLollipop.label: Create Lollipop
markersCreateLollipop.help: Add an extra 'lollipop' control to marked nodes, to more easily find relevant marker attributes.

markersIgnoreJoints.name: markersIgnoreJoints
markersIgnoreJoints.label: Ignore Joints
markersIgnoreJoints.help: Do not record to joints, these are typically read-only.

markersAutoLimit.name: markersAutoLimit
markersAutoLimit.label: Auto Limit
markersAutoLimit.help: Transfer the locked state of rotate XYZ into locked limits.

markersUseSelection.name: markersUseSelection
markersUseSelection.label: Use Selection
markersUseSelection.help: Should I record only to the selected controls?

markersRecordReset.name: markersRecordReset
markersRecordReset.label: Reset Markers
markersRecordReset.help: Make all markers kinematic once recording is complete.

markersRecordMaintainOffset2.name: markersRecordMaintainOffset2
markersRecordMaintainOffset2.label: Maintain Offset
markersRecordMaintainOffset2.help: Should I keep the offset between marker and control as I record?

markersRecordKinematic.name: markersRecordKinematic
markersRecordKinematic.label: Include Kinematic Keys
markersRecordKinematic.help: Should I include non-simulated (kinematic) motion during the record?

markersRecordSimplify.name: markersRecordSimplify
markersRecordSimplify.label: Simplify Recorded Channels
markersRecordSimplify.help: Should I reduce static keys and generally make the result easier to work with?

markersRecordUnroll.name: markersRecordUnroll
markersRecordUnroll.label: Unroll Rotations
markersRecordUnroll.help: Should I let rotations go beyond 180 degrees? Generally yes, for things like motion blur and anything happening between two keys.

markersRecordFilter.name: markersRecordFilter
markersRecordFilter.label: Rotation Filter
markersRecordFilter.help: Ragdoll can't recognise rotations past 180 degrees, this filter enables Maya's curves to do that anyway.

markersRecordToLayer.name: markersRecordToLayer
markersRecordToLayer.label: Record to Layer
markersRecordToLayer.help: Put all simulation onto a new Animation Layer

markersAppendTarget.name: markersAppendTarget
markersAppendTarget.label: Append
markersAppendTarget.help: Should I replace the current target, or add another?

autoInitialState.name: autoInitialState
autoInitialState.label: Auto Initial State
autoInitialState.help: (Requires scene reopen) Whether or not to use the pose of a rigid at the start time as the active initial state. This feature records the pose from frame 1 at frame 2, by inserting itself in between finished evaluation of frame 1 and yet-to-begin evaluation of frame 2.

monitorScale.name: monitorScale
monitorScale.label: Monitor Scale
monitorScale.help: (Requires scene reopen) Synchonise viewport rendering with scale of rigids. Without this, synchronisation happens after playback followed by a re-select.

frameskipHandling.name: frameskipHandling
frameskipHandling.label: Frameskip Handling
frameskipHandling.help: What should Ragdoll do when one or more frames are skipped? Should Ragdoll pause simulation until you revisit the last-known frame? Or just pretend everything is OK, and produce garbage values?

autoUpgrade.name: autoUpgrade
autoUpgrade.label: Auto Upgrade
autoUpgrade.help: Whether or not to ask before upgrading a scene saved with an older version of Ragdoll.

globalsValidations.name: globalsValidations
globalsValidations.label: Validations
globalsValidations.default: Various pre-flight checks to ensure Ragdoll is performing optimally.

validateEvaluationMode.name: validateEvaluationMode
validateEvaluationMode.help: Check whether Maya is evaluating in Parallel or Serial whenever creating a new scene, as DG is slow and error-prone.

validateLegacyOpenGL2.name: validateLegacyOpenGL2
validateLegacyOpenGL2.label: Validate Legacy OpenGL
validateLegacyOpenGL2.help: Check whether Viewport 2.0 is set to render using Legacy OpenGL. That isn't supported.

validateCachingMode.name: validateCachingMode
validateCachingMode.help: Check whether Maya is caching dynamics, which is required in order for Cached Playback to work with Ragdoll.

validateRotatePivot.name: validateRotatePivot
validateRotatePivot.help: Check whether the selected transform has a non-zero rotatePivot; they are unsupported and will be zeroed out.

validateScalePivot.name: validateScalePivot
validateScalePivot.help: Check whether the selected transform has a non-zero scalePivot; they are unsupported and will be zeroed out.

validatePlaybackSpeed.name: validatePlaybackSpeed
validatePlaybackSpeed.help: Make sure Maya's playback speed is set to 'Play every frame'.

validateRotateAxis.name: validateRotateAxis
validateRotateAxis.help: Let the user know of a Ragdoll limitation, that a custom rotate axis are unsupported.

validateRotateOrder.name: validateRotateOrder
validateRotateOrder.help: Let the user know of a Ragdoll limitation, that a custom rotate order are currently unsupported.

validateScale.name: validateScale
validateScale.help: Let the user know of a Ragdoll limitation, that scale is unsupported.

sceneScale.name: sceneScale
sceneScale.help: (Requires plug-in reload) Internal tolerances to use when computing convex meshes and some forces, default is 0.1 meaning things are assumed 10x smaller than real-world scale e.g. a character is 17 cm tall.

useProxyAttributes.name: useProxyAttributes
useProxyAttributes.help: Use native Maya proxy attributes for Ragdoll user attributes. CAUTION! This is unstable and may fatal crash Maya, especially during deletion of physics.

useUIDrawManager.name: useUIDrawManager
useUIDrawManager.help: Whether to draw lines and things using Maya's native API, which appears broken on some hardware...

deleteFromSelection.name: deleteFromSelection
deleteFromSelection.help: Limit deletion to selection-only, rather than the whole scene.

deleteAttributesToo.name: deleteAttributesToo
deleteAttributesToo.help: Delete custom attributes, if any, in addition to Ragdoll nodes.

constraintOutlinerStyle.name: constraintOutlinerStyle
constraintOutlinerStyle.label: Outliner Style
constraintOutlinerStyle.help: Where to put the new constraint, either as (1) a new transform at the root of your Maya scene like nCloth/nHair, (2) a child of the rigid parent like Maya's native constraints or (3) as a shape next to the rdRigid node.

constraintAddUserAttributes.name: constraintAddUserAttributes
constraintAddUserAttributes.label: Standalone
constraintAddUserAttributes.help: Give constraints their own transform at the root of the outliner.

ogsReset.name: ogsReset
ogsReset.label: DG Viewport Fix
ogsReset.help: Improve viewport robustness when simulating in DG Evaluation mode, by calling `ogs -reset` on the start frame. Bear in mind this action is global to Maya and may negatively (or positively) affect other nodes in your scene.

maya2018ConsolidateWorldFix.name: maya2018ConsolidateWorldFix
maya2018ConsolidateWorldFix.label: Maya 2018 Consolidate World Fix
maya2018ConsolidateWorldFix.help: Work around a limitation in Maya 2018 to better support rigid textures and sleep rendering.

skinweightsFix.name: skinweightsFix
skinweightsFix.label: Fix right-click menu on joints with a rigid
skinweightsFix.help: When joints have a shape, such as a rigid body, the right-click menu breaks when wanting to 'Select Influence'. This fixes that, but *may* cause issues elsewhere since it modifies the Maya native context menu for joints. Disable this if it causes any other inconvenience.

lastVisitedPath.name: lastVisitedPath
lastVisitedPath.label: Last Visited Path
lastVisitedPath.help: Remember and restore the directory last browsed to for importing and exporting of physics.

useShaders.name: useShaders
useShaders.label: Use Shaders
useShaders.help: Render using GLSL shaders in place of Maya factory Blinn.

reloadShaders.name: reloadShaders
reloadShaders.label: Reload Shaders
reloadShaders.help: Interactively reload shaders on the creation of a new rdSolver node.

shaderPath.name: shaderPath
shaderPath.label: Shader Path
shaderPath.help: Absolute path to where shaders are located.

fontPath.name: fontPath
fontPath.label: Font Path
fontPath.help: Absolute path to where fonts are located.
